title: ASL 8.3 — Storytelling: Character Emotions
objectives: Express character emotions through facial grammar and body posture
Differentiate between narrator-neutral and character-emotional modes

vocab.def: Flat expression to show you are outside the story.
Switching characters using gaze and body turn.
Exaggerated facial/hand movement to show strong emotion.
Small cue (eyebrows, lip press) for light emotion.

sections.heading: 1. Why Emotion Matters
sections.body: In ASL storytelling, emotions give characters life. Without affect, role-shifts can look flat or confusing. Emotions also guide the audience’s response.

sections.heading: 2. Neutral vs. Emotional Mode

media.alt: Demonstration of neutral narrator vs. emotional character
media.caption: Compare flat narration to expressive character affect.

sections.body: Practice switching: *Neutral face (narrator)* → *Shift right, angry father* → *Shift left, sad child*.

sections.heading: 3. Emotion Drill
sections.body: Partner A signs the same sentence three times, each with a different affect (happy, angry, sad). Partner B identifies the intended emotion.

microCheck.q: What signals emotion most clearly in ASL?

sections.heading: 4. Mini-Story Practice
sections.body: Tell a short 3–4 line story: *Yesterday, a student lost their homework. The teacher was frustrated. The student was embarrassed.* Use role-shifts and emotional affect.

sections.heading: 5. Reflection
sections.body: Journal or record: Which emotion was hardest to show clearly? Which one felt most natural?

items.q: What is the role of affect in ASL storytelling?
When role-shifting, how do you show different characters?
Gloss a 2-line story that shows two emotions (happy and sad).

items.prompt: Which emotional affect do you want to practice more and why?

reflectionPrompt: Record a 30–45s story where at least two characters show different emotions. Upload with captions identifying each role and affect.
summary: You practiced adding emotional affect to role-shift storytelling, giving characters life and clarity.

games.title: Story Face
outcomes: Shift smoothly between neutral and character affect
